data.title: Zed Bias’ ‘Neighbourhood’ EP is getting reissued for the first time in 24 years
data.meta_description: The UKG classic will be re-released with two remixes on vinyl and digital formats
data.text:
Zed Bias’ seminal ‘Neighbourhood’ EP is getting reissued on vinyl as well as for the first time digitally.

Originally released in 1999, the UKG classic will be re-released later this year including two remixes from El-B and Dawn Raid.

Read this next: Need for speed: Why the UK fell back in love with bassline and speed garage

The 'Original 98 Mix' features the vocals of UK artists MC Rumpus and Nicky Prince and 24 years on from its release; while remixes from El-B (otherwise known as one half of Groove Chronicles) and Hocus Pocus honchos Dawn Raid, are putting a new spin on the beloved garage classic.

Currently, streaming services have access to sharing a radio mix of the track but later this year, the original will be available — perfect timing for UKG fans to get into the throes of the classic.

Read this next: Daft Punk to release unheard music for 'Random Access Memories' 10th anniversary reissue

Last month, Zed Bias debuted his new imprint I Feel Good Records (IFG), minting the label with its first single 'You Should Dance' with Inja on MC duties.

The ‘Neighbourhood’ reissue will be out October 9 via Bias' new label, I Feel Good Records.
